thread.title: Kristaps Porzingis forced to sit as quad proving tricky
thread.title_full: Kristaps Porzingis forced to sit as quad proving tricky | New York Post

author: Marc Berman
title: Kristaps Porzingis forced to sit as quad proving tricky
text:
Kristaps Porzingis, coming off a successful nine-point, 10-rebound outing Friday in Washington, will sit Monday night against the 76ers at the Garden with an upper left quad strain sustained in Sunday’s practice.
It’s roughly the same injury that stopped his pre-draft workout with the Knicks last spring, Derek Fisher said, “but not as severe.’’
“We’re not as concerned,’’ Fisher said.
Porzingis also hurt his left knee in training camp at West Point, tweaking his IT band, which forced him out two straight days.
“He’s still a young man in his physical development,’’ Fisher said. “It’s the second time with this particular injury so of course we could adjust and do something different [with his training].’’
The 7-foot-3 rookie from Latvia had a shaky Garden debut Wednesday against Bauru of Brazil, committing two turnovers and shooting 2 of 7. He said he was overanxious playing at the Garden for his first time.
“We’re pretty hopeful we’ll have him back by Friday [against Boston],’’ Fisher said.
The Sixers were also not going to play Jahlil Okafor, the No. 3 pick in the draft, selected one slot before Porzingis.
Okafor has looked heavy during the preseason. Porzingis and Okafor battled during the Las Vegas summer league, with the Latvian blocking three of his shots.
